alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Livingston; St. Helena; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 6:02PM CST until February 16 at 7:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR EAST BATON ROUGE, EAST FELICIANA, NORTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON, ST. HELENA AND SOUTHEASTERN WEST FELICIANA PARISHES AND SOUTHWESTERN AMITE COUNTY... At 602 PM CST, 4-6 inches of rain fell earlier in the day resulting in flash flooding. While the heavy rains have moved out of the area, it will be take some time for the water to drain out of the flooded areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may still experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Jackson, Clinton, Greensburg, Slaughter, Wilson, Norwood, Pride, Greenwell Spring, Watson, Darlington, Brownfields, Felps, Merrydale, Easleyville and Westminster. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 161. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Livingston; St. Helena; West Feliciana
